column5: $45 a month ? Or $45 a week ? Kind of misleading !
Not at all misleading. Their ad says $45 per month. The user is only going to use it for roughly 7 days. His cost is $45 for his week of usage. What part of that do you not understand?.
Roughly ? What is Roughly ? He said 7 days which calculates to $ 11.25 a week ! Understand ? I didn't think so.....lol.

What part of $45 dollars do you NOT understand?Just because he is only using a partial month does not reduce the minimum available block of time offered by the storage company. Sheesh Did you see a weekly rate in their ad?

To get the full value of the parking rate he should stay with his brother-in-law for an additional three weeks after the Canada trip and pick up the vehicle at the end of the months rental. Should also check if the rental fee is in USD or CAD or RUB, can make a huge difference!
Better yet, maximize the parking value by spending a month in Canada fishing!
I like the way you think! Bill

[QUOTE=v-bay gord;6744555]I can see the logic here!Not sure what my brother-in-law would do when I kicked him off the boat after 7-days, though. But he would have a few weeks to hitchhike back to his car... 🤣
Kudos Huntindave. This is great advice.
[QUOTE=a_hershy;6744583]His lack of planning is not your emergency.

Learned a lot reading WC posts. So, thought I would look for some experience/expertise here on a pretty random Canada trip question.My brother-inlaw will be joining me on the trip to Lac Seul in July. He lives in eastern Iowa; I'm in eastern Nebraska. Clear Lake is the spot our path first cross. So I'm looking for suggestions on where we might park a car for the week as he jumps in with me.I know - odd question, but if you have a suggestion please message me. Thankshershy

WalMarts are generally very accommodating about overnight parking; in fact they are a favorite spot for RVer's. However, the overnight parking policies are left to the discretion of the local store managers - so if you think you might what to try that, you'd need to call the nearest Walmart, probably Mason City. You of course would have to decide whether you are comfortable with the security of leaving your car there for any period of time - it's not the store's concern. Cheers.
Park it at a Hy-vee in Mason city and make sure there's insurance on it !
Walleyechowder might be on your route,park it in his driveway,he's a kind hearted soul.
Local police department.

U-Haul Self Storage11262 265th St, Mason City, IA 50401 (641) 243-4695Vehicle Storage (RV, Boat, Car & More)Keep vehicles secure, avoid space limitations at home, and avoid neighborhood ordinances. Vehicle storage options include open parking space, covered spaces, or indoor/enclosed storage. Large | 10' x 30' x 50'RV/Boat/Vehicle/Parking Lower Level Outside Level Drivethrough No Climate No Electricity BonusRV, Boat, and Vehicle StorageRate:$45.00Per Month$45 for the week= That's only $6.50 a day to park in a secure locked lot.
^^^^^^^^ problem solved....
Good info. It's informative posts such as this that keep me subscribed. Thank you.

In the past we have parked vehicles at the airport at Mason City. It is free, and we never had any issues. I am not sure, but think they have a "security" person who drives the lots. It's just off I-35 so easy on and off access. The storage place mentioned above is a good deal for $45 though, and no need to worry about security or other issues. Good luck!
Agreed.Knew I came to the right spot.
